Dialogue.content: Hi, I'm Isabella. It's nice to meet you!
Hello, Isabella! It's great to meet you too. What's on your mind today?
I'm really excited for the semester to start. I'm studying Graphic Design, and I have an upcoming art exhibition!
That sounds fantastic! It must feel great to have such an exciting opportunity. Are there any concerns that come with it?
Yeah, I'm feeling pressure to balance my coursework with my art preparation, especially since my dad hasn't been feeling well. I want to support my family too.
It's wonderful that you care about your family, but it's understandable to feel anxious. How are you managing these responsibilities?
Hi again. I'm feeling really overwhelmed now. There's so much going on.
Hello again, Isabella! I'm glad you're back. What's been particularly overwhelming for you?
With my dad being unwell and the exhibition approaching, I've been losing sleep. I feel like I'm not giving enough to either my studies or my family.
That sounds like a heavy burden to bear. Have you had any time for yourself lately to recharge?
Not really, I've been so focused on everything else... I miss sketching and cooking.
It's important to take breaks and engage with your hobbies. What if you set short time limits for both study and personal time?
Hey, I just came back from a group critique and I didn't feel good about it. I feel inadequate.
Hi, Isabella. I'm sorry to hear that. What happened during the critique?
My designs were criticized harshly, and I just felt so exposed. It makes me doubt my skills.
Feeling vulnerable during critiques is common, especially when you care about your work. Did you get any constructive feedback?
Some, but I'm still feeling the weight of it all. I talked to Clara about my feelings, but I'm still disheartened.
It's okay to feel disheartened. Remember that every artist faces criticism. Can you think of one positive takeaway from the critique?
Hi! I saw a counselor on campus. Sharing my thoughts felt good, but I'm still figuring things out.
That's great to hear, Isabella! How did it feel to talk about your struggles?
It was relieving, but they emphasized the need for self-care and boundaries. I'm worried about whether I can really make those changes.
It's normal to feel unsure about implementing change. What's one small step you could take to practice self-care this week?
I think I'll try to set aside some time for either sketching or cooking—something I enjoy.
That sounds like a wonderful plan! Even small moments of creativity can help rejuvenate your spirit. Keep me updated on how it goes!
Thank you so much for your support! I really appreciate it.
